alert.note: Alert for Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Northern Sacramento Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 11:04AM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Tehama and southwestern Shasta Counties through 1145 AM PDT... At 1104 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Olinda to near Paskenta. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anderson, Flournoy, Henleyville, Paskenta, Blossom, Rancho Tehama Reserve and Cottonwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Mountains Southwestern Shasta County to Western Colusa County; Northern Sacramento Valley
